summary: The grizzly bear, also called the North American brown bear, lives in North America. It's a type of brown bear, with several related populations, like the Kodiak and Kamchatka bears. Some are bigger, some are smaller, depending on where they live. The "black grizzly" in Asia is not a separate type but just another brown bear subspecies. The grizzly was once found across North America but is now mostly in the west.
title: Grizzly bear
